Articles.Content:
How can we possibly update the part cost?

part does not have any cost property, it only have a GetModuleCost method.

Can we use this somehow?

Edited May 11, 2015 by FreeThinker
GetModulesCost is from the PartModules. If you want strictly the part's cost, it's part.partInfo.cost (AvailablePart.cost). You can modify it through ModuleManager or just change it through code.

I found something interesting. If the module implement, GetModulesCost, it seems to be called at a change event. It allows you to return the cost you want it to be. This is great if you want a tanks cheape or more expansive than the resource is worth.

Edited May 10, 2015 by FreeThinker
Yes, that's they whole point of this interface. It allows you to add/remove cost to a given part with a module.
